subject: Re: TestUtil: By Example
msgSnippet: Mark, What an interesting idea.  I ve never considered instrumenting functional code in a manner altering unit test execution. However, the notion of
messageBody:
Mark,

What an interesting idea. I've never considered instrumenting
functional code in a manner "altering" unit test execution.

However, the notion of instrumenting Javadoc is an elegant solution to
the indirection imposed by a descriptor document - without
(technically) altering the functional code.

Being out of ideas for a v. 1.2 release - thanks for alleviating my
spare-time problem :-).

http://gtcgroup.com/util/index.html

_Marvin

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Mark Levison <mlevison@...> wrote:
>
> Marvin - I've had a good look and it looks very interesting. The one
> thing I'm leary of is the separate XML file to mark the cases to
> ignore. Have you considered using Javadoc tags that you could pick up
> via reflection? This has the distinct advantage that the tags to
> ignore a method pair are tied to the methods.
>
> Otherwise it looks very interesting.
>
> Cheers
> Mark
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
-
> Blog: http://dotnetjunkies.com/WebLog/mlevison/
>
